t: For the director of music. A maskil of the Sons of Korah.
As*pn the deer pants for streams of water, so*ld my soul pants for you, my God.
My*ln soul thirsts for God, for the living God. When*ld can I go and meet with God?
My*ln tears have been my food day*ld and night, while*ln people say to me all day long, “Where*ld is your God?”
These*ln things I remember as*ld I pour out my soul: how*ln I used to go to the house of God under*ld the protection of the Mighty One with*ln shouts of joy and praise among*ld the festive throng.
Why,*pn my soul, are you downcast? Why*ld so disturbed within me? Put*ln your hope in God, for*ld I will yet praise him, my*ld Savior and my God.
My*pn soul is downcast within me; therefore*ld I will remember you from*ln the land of the Jordan, the*ld heights of Hermon—from Mount Mizar.
Deep*ln calls to deep in*ld the roar of your waterfalls; all*ln your waves and breakers have*ld swept over me.
By*pn day the Lord*s directs his love, at*ld night his song is with me— a*ld prayer to the God of my life.
I*pn say to God my Rock, “Why*ld have you forgotten me? Why*ln must I go about mourning, oppressed*ld by the enemy?”
My*ln bones suffer mortal agony as*ld my foes taunt me, saying*ln to me all day long, “Where*ld is your God?”
Why,*pn my soul, are you downcast? Why*ld so disturbed within me? Put*ln your hope in God, for*ld I will yet praise him, my*ld Savior and my God.
